chapter.title: Advanced
chapter.para: In this chapter we will show some advanced settings and tools for Redborder configuration and administration.

section.title: Architecture
section.para: Redborder has an open source based architecture, using technologies like Snort, Kafka or Logstash.
All these technologies are orquested by Zookeeper and Chef, so it is important to have those services running for the good functioning of Redborder.

section.title: Operations
section.para: There are some important operations that must be executed in order to do advanced settings in Redborder.

listitem.para: motd: Motd shows general info about node and cluster
rb_get_managers.rb: Shows information about nodes on the cluster
rb_get_services.sh: Get all the services status on the node. Used with option all shows information for all nodes. If optional the service is added too, only the status of this service is shown
rb_set_service.rb: Allows to enable or disable a service.
rb_service: Allows to work with a service. It can start, stop and restart services. Can be used with services such as postgresql, riak, hadoop, zookeeper, druid, kafka, chef and more.
rb_set_topics.rb: Assign the destination of the topic, which can be samza or realtime. Corresponding services need to be started to keep the correct working of the redborder platform.
rb_cluster_configure.rb: Get all services status for all nodes. Allows to change the configuration for the whole cluster.
rb_manager_ssh.sh: This command is used to move or execute another command on other node.
rb_manager_scp.sh: This script is used to copy a file from the manager where is being launched to all other nodes or a list of nodes.
rb_cluster_reboot.sh: Order the reboot for all cluster nodes.
rb_cluster_update.sh: It is used to upgrade the manager to a new released version.
rb_get_tasks.rb: Gets information about indexing service.
rb_wakeup_chef: Starts the chef-client in all the nodes.

section.title: Redborder technologies
section.para: In this section we will explain the main technologies Redborder uses to manage and use all data it is provided.
All main technologies used in Redborder are open source, which allows period updates and more quality.

section.title: Siddhi
section.para: Siddhi is an open source Complex Event Processor that Redborder uses in vault module to apply rules to incoming events. It allows us to create rules that can alert us from any kind of behaviour reflected in the events.
Siddhi is used in Redborder to make it able to raise alarm when a determinate situation is present in the network.
Siddhi uses an SQL sentence structure, so it is possible to edit all rules included in Redborder by default.
It is necessary to have certain level of knowledge about Siddhi to create useful rules.
It is necessary to activate the correlation engine. This will use more machine resources, so it is necessary to be sure that the system has enought RAM memory.

caption.para: Siddhi rules available in the manager correlation engine

section.title: Snort
section.para: Snort is an open source network intrusion prevention system that process and analyzes real time traffic.
Redborder uses Snort in intrussion module to configure multiple rule policies, as well as store and analyze the alerts generated.
Snort system is based in rules, which are partially provided by the community.
It is possible to update the rules manually, so it ensures that, with the lastest set of Snort rules, the traffic is being analyzed and monitorized.

section.title: Hadoop
section.para: Hadoop is an open source distributed processing framework that manages data processing and storage for big data applications running in clustered systems.
It's used by Redborder to provide real time traffic analysis of Big Data.

Also, Hadoop is not enabled by default in a Redborder manager, because of its requirements of resources. It is very important to have strong resources to run Redborder using Hadoop, at least 64Gb RAM.

section.title: Radius
section.para: Remote Authentication Dial-In User Service (RADIUS) is a networking protocol, operating on port 1812, that provides centralized Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting (AAA or Triple A) management for users who connect and use a network service. The RadiusProcessor class belongs to the rb-Samza-bi module.

RADIUS is a client/server protocol that runs in the application layer, and can use either TCP or UDP as transport. Network access servers, the gateways that control access to a network, usually contain a RADIUS client component that communicates with the RADIUS server. RADIUS is often the back-end of choice for 802.1X authentication as well.
In a redborder manager, by activating the advanced options in General Settings, it is possible to access a section called Radius Accounting and Radius Proxy Authentication.

caption.para: General Settings: Radius Accounting and Radius Proxy Authentication section

section.title: Radius authentication server
section.para: This section allows to activate a Radius authentication server. The user must indicate the Host IP and password.
Add a Radius Accounting server: It is possible to add a new Radius Server by clicking on the +Add tab, then enter the shared IP and password. Click Update to save the changes made.
Delete a Radius Accounting server: Click on the Delete icon next to the Radius server information to discard it.

section.title: Radius Proxy Authentication
section.para: This section allows you to activate a Radius authentication proxy server. The user must indicate the IP of the source Host, the IP of the destination Host and the respective passwords.

Add a Radius authentication proxy server: It is possible to add a new Radius Proxy Server by clicking on the +Add tab, then enter the IP of the source Host, the IP of the destination Host and the respective passwords. Click Update to save the changes made.
Delete a Radius authentication proxy server: Click on the Delete icon next to the proxy server information to discard it.

section.title: Bulkstats
section.para: Bulk statistics are statistics that are collected in a group or scheme, for example, system statistics, port statistics, or Radius statistics.

It's possible to display Bulkstats information in the redBorder manager, for this it is necessary to configure the client part in the Cisco device to activate the sending of information to the manager via ftp.
Once this is done, we can view all the information regarding Bulkstats in the redBorder manager by accessing its corresponding tab and selecting the desired fields within the Monitor module.
But... How to define a custom bulkstat monitor?

To define custom Bulkstats monitor crafted specifically for a Bulkstats schema, it necessary that the user have a bulkstats schema in their network device. Once having this requirement, then navigate to the Monitor Categories view.
It's located in: Tools -> Monitor Categories.
Before proceding to uploading it, the user must save the schema into a plan text file and give it a name for example: Bulkstats-Schema.txt.
The file created should be a plain txt file and must contain the bulkstats schema that is define in the network device. Normaly the bulkstats schemas looks like this:
Then click on New Monitor Category button and a modal will be displayed:
Inside the new monitor category formulary select Bulkstats under the Technology list. This will display the new option to put your bulkstats schema file that define the user configuration.
To assign the new monitor category to a device sensor, it's necessary to create a device monitor if the user don't have one yet from Sensor Tree view.
Click on the sensor menu and then click on Monitors.
Then click on the category + Add Monitor

caption.para: Monitors for Device: Add Monitor category

section.para: Once this is done, the user must click on the + Add button to add the monitor category described above.

caption.para: Monitors for Device: Add Monitors modal displayed

section.para: Once added the monitor to the sensor, It would diplay the destination where need to configure the device to send.
The url corresponds to the destination path. It is necessary to configure sftp protocol in the device network to send the information regarding the bulkstat schemes to the manager.
